Description.val:
Small and Medium Unmanned Undersea Vehicles (UUVs) are a segment of the Navy's Family of UUVs defined as having a diameter between 3 inches and 10 inches for small UUVs and a diameter of 10 inches to 21 inches for medium UUVs. The UUVs can be launched from small boats, surface ships, submarines, or larger UUVs and recovered by surface ships and some submarines. Small and Medium UUVs currently provide the warfighter battlespace awareness, Intelligence Preparation of the Operational Environment (IPOE), and Mine Warfare (MIW) capability including buried and volume mine hunting.

Beginning in FY21 and continuing across the FYDP, funding previously included in OPN LI 0977 for procurement of Expeditionary MCM Unmanned Undersea Vehicles (UUVs) is now included in the Small And Medium Class UUV OPN LI 1611.

[P40A / Littoral Battlespace Sensors-Autonomous Unmanned Vehicle (Submarine variant) (LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback)]: LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback provides Intelligence Preparation of the Operational Environment (IPOE) payload capabilities for submarine launched missions. Razorback will be deployed from host submarines via the dry deck shelter (DDS) or from the Torpedo Tube.

In FY21 the LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback program will continue production support and fielding of LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback DDS systems. Funding provides for LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback DDS upgrades/backfits, for implementing Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs) to correct design issues identified during system testing and to incorporate Fleet feedback. Funding provides production oversight and quality assurance support of systems procured in FY18 and FY19, enabling delivery in a service ready condition. Funding also provides for Design Services Allocation (DSA) for the development of alteration installation drawings and documentation, and for the conduct of alteration installation in support of FY21 DDS-equipped submarine missions.

[P5 / MU001 KNIFEFISH (SMCM UUV w/LFBB)]: The Knifefish Surface Mine Countermeasure Unmanned Undersea Vehicle (SMCM UUV) program procures Unmanned Undersea Vehicles to support clandestine mine detection capability against volume and bottom mines including buried mine detection. The Knifefish system is composed of two UUVs, batteries, launch and handling system, and other support equipment.

Beginning in Fiscal Year (FY) 2020, Knifefish (SMCM UUV) was moved from OPN Line Item (LI) 2622 into OPN LI 1611.

Justification.val:
The Small and Medium UUVs line item was new in FY 2020, combining systems from OPN LI 2622 Minesweeping Replacement (Knifefish) and OPN LI 4226 Meteorological Equipment (LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback).

The FY21 budget procures LBS-AUV(s)/Razorback Upgrades/Backfits and TEMPALT installation support. Additionally, the FY21 budget procures two (2) Knifefish Systems, ancillary equipment, and associated support engineering.

OCO: 
ExMCM Unmanned Undersea Vehicle (UUV) Systems - FY2021 Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO) funding for Operation Freedom Sentinel - In Theater (OFS-T) to procure additional MK18 UUV Family of Systems (FoS) to reset from operational losses in theater in support of COMFIFTHFLT Global Force Management (GFM) and Operational Plan (OPLAN) requirements.

Name.@footnote: Littoral Battlespace Sensors-Autonomous Undersea Vehicles (Submarine variant) (LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback) are broken out between LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback units and LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback Shipsets. Shipsets consist of the operation van, maintenance van, and launch & recovery system. LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback includes LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback vehicles, LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback Dry-Deck Shelter (DDS) Submarine Support Systems, Torpedo-tube Launch and Recover (TTL&R) Submarine Support Systems and TTL&R SAFECAPs. LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback DDS Submarine Support Systems consist of operational and maintenance equipment including launch, mooring and submarine modification kits for DDS operations. LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback TTL&R Submarine Support Systems consist of operational and maintenance equipment including launch, mooring and submarine modification kits for TTL&R operations. The LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback TTL&R SAFECAP consists of operational and maintenance equipment required to safely ship, stow, and deploy an AUV with lithium batteries from a submarine torpedo tube. FY21 provides funding for technology upgrades and back-fits (additional sensor integration, new battery technology insertion, etc.)  Beginning in Fiscal Year (FY) 2020 LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback was moved from OPN Line Item (LI) 4226 into OPN LI 1611.
Name.val: 1) Littoral Battlespace Sensors-Autonomous Unmanned Vehicle (Submarine variant) (LBS-AUV(S)/R

Name.@footnote: LBS-AUV(S)/Razorback units installing in FY20 were procured under BLI 4226 (funding in FY20 and out transferred from BLI 4226 to BLI 1611). A single Dry Deck Shelter (DDS), LBS-AUV(S) Razorback install consists of two LBS-AUV(S) vehicles and a DDS submarine support system. A single Torpedo Tube Launch & Recovery (TTL&R) install consists of a TTL&R submarine support system and an equal amount of TTL&R SAFECAPs and LBS-AUV(S) vehicles. The submarine support system and LBS-AUV(S) Razorback installs are based on mission requirements.

The Small and Medium UUVs line item (LI) is new in FY 2020, realigning systems from OPN LI 2622 Minesweeping Replacement (Knifefish).  The Knifefish Surface Mine Countermeasure Unmanned Undersea Vehicle (SMCM UUV) program procures Unmanned Undersea Vehicles to support clandestine mine detection capability against volume and bottom mines, including buried mine detection. The Knifefish system is composed of two UUVs, batteries, launch and handling system, and other support equipment.

Name.val: MU002 MK 18 UUV FAMILY OF SYSTEMS

Name.@footnote: CE 2.1.1 MK 18 MOD 2 UUV: Provides for procurement of MK 18 Mod 2 UUVs which will be employed in operational missions in Shallow Water (SW) and Very Shallow Water (VSW) environments including GFM deployments of Expeditionary MCM (ExMCM) Companies ISO C5F and C7F. These UUVs are a critical component of the ExMCM detect to engage sequence for undersea mines.  This procurement supports the capacity growth of the Navy's Expeditionary MCM force to 16 companies over the FYDP.  These MK 18 Mod 2 UUVs will outfit companies 9-12.

CE 2.1.2 MK 18 MOD 1 UUV: Provides for procurement of MK 18 Mod 1 UUVs which will be employed in operational missions in Shallow Water (SW) and Very Shallow Water (VSW) environments including GFM deployments of Expeditionary MCM (ExMCM) Companies ISO C5F and C7F. These UUVs are a critical component of the ExMCM detect to engage sequence for undersea mines.  This procurement supports the capacity growth of the Navy's Expeditionary MCM force to 16 companies over the FYDP.  These MK 18 Mod 2 UUVs will outfit companies 9-12.

CE 2.1.3 ExMCM AUXILIARY, SUPPORT, MAINTENANCE, and MISSION SUPPORT EQUIPMENT KITS: The ExMCM Aux Kits includes equipment required for ExMCM deployment, pre-mission planning and post mission analysis. In addition, new auxiliary kits will be procured to support enhancements to legacy fleet systems through engineering changes, system upgrades and obsolescence of legacy auxiliary kits. Items include equipment required to deploy the ExMCM equipment such as transport carts, transport cases, test equipment, pre-mission planning equipment not covered in the support or maintenance kits The ExMCM Support Kit comprises GETACs, Post-Mission Analysis (PMA) stations, cross-domain modules, and other support items that comprise a portion of the ExMCM system outfitting. The Maintenance Kit comprises special tool kits, calibration equipment, fly away maintenance modules, and other maintenance items. Unit cost of

CE 2.1.4 MK18 MOD 2 ADVANCED SENSOR KITS SMALL SYNTHETIC APERTURE MINEHUNTER (SSAM) SONAR): Provides for procurement of MK 18 Mod 2 UUV Advanced sensor retrofit kits, which will be employed in operational missions in Shallow Water (SW) and Very Shallow Water (VSW) environments including GFM deployments of Expeditionary MCM Companies ISO C5F and C7F. These SSAM retrofit kits add advanced sensor capability to the MK18 Mod 2 which increases area coverage rate and resolution of side scan sonar images of the sea floor which decreases the detect to engage timeline for Expeditionary MCM companies to enable rapid Fleet Maneuver against near peer adversaries.

CE 2.1.5 MK18 MOD 2 ADVANCED SENSOR KITS (ATLAS FORWARD LOOK SONAR): Provides for procurement of UUV MK 18 Mod 2 retrofit kits, which will be employed in operational missions in Shallow Water (SW) and Very Shallow Water (VSW) environments including GFM deployments of Expeditionary MCM Companies ISO C5F and C7F. These ATLAS retrofit kits add advanced sensor capability to the MK 18 Mod 2 system, specifically the ability to detect sea mines and other hazards in the volume of water (vice the sea floor) to enable rapid Fleet Maneuver against near peer adversaries.

CE 2.1.6 MK 18 MOD 2 RETROFIT KITS (INCREMENT II): Provides for procurement of UUV MK 18 Mod 2 retrofit kits, which will be employed in operational missions in Shallow Water (SW) and Very Shallow Water (VSW) environments including GFM deployments of Expeditionary MCM  Companies ISO C5F and C7F. These retrofit kits add capability that improves reliability, autonomous features, and automated target recognition capabilities. This upgrade kit reduces the detect to engage timeline for Expeditionary MCM Companies to enable Fleet Maneuver against near peer adversaries.

CE 2.1.7 MK18 FAMILY OF SYSTEMS (FoS) RESET: Reset funding for replacement of UUV losses that occurred during fleet operations in support of COMNAVCENT missions.  OCO resources will restore forces to full operational readiness to meet C5F mission needs.
